name: Reggaetón
description: Rooted in Dancehall and mainly characterized by its heavy emphasis on the "dembow" rhythm; developed in Puerto Rico in the early 1990s under heavy influence from Hip Hop.

children.name: Bachatón
children.description: Mixes Bachata melodies and instrumentation with Reggaetón rhythms, rapping, and DJing.

children.name: Cubaton
children.description: Rhythmically and vocally inspired by major elements of Cuban Music.

children.name: Cumbiatón
children.description: Combining Reggaetón  with Cumbia mexicana, and less frequently with other forms of traditional Mexican Music.

children.name: Doble paso
children.description: Frenetic and intense high tempo variant in comparison to the standard drum patterns, often used to accompany the dance of the same name.

children.name: Neoperreo
children.description: Heavy emphasis on rhythm, influence from global trends in club music, and generally progressive lyrics.

children.name: RKT
children.description: Emerged in the early 2010s, characterized by minimalistic, rhythm-centric production heavily influenced by Cumbia villera and other Cumbia argentina styles.

children.name: Romantic Style
children.description: Melodic and sentimental style characterized by emotive vocals and mellow sound with a less explicit tone, emphasizing romantic love themes, blending Contemporary R&B, Latin Pop and romantic ballad influences, popularized during early 2000s to 2010s.
